Uses of Package
javaslang.control

  • Packages that use javaslang.control 
    Package Description
    javaslang.algebra
    Algebraic interfaces used to describe inherent class properties like Monad.
    javaslang.collection
    Immutable collections based on Traversable like the linked list List and the lazy linked list Stream.
    javaslang.control
    Control structures like Match, the disjoint union type Either, the optional value type Option and Try for exception handling.
    javaslang.test
    A property check framework built around Property which integrates well with unit test frameworks like junit.
  • Classes in javaslang.control used by javaslang.algebra 
    Class and Description
    Try.CheckedConsumer
    A Consumer which may throw.
    Try.CheckedFunction
    A Function which may throw.
    Try.CheckedPredicate
    A Predicate which may throw.
  • Classes in javaslang.control used by javaslang.collection 
    Class and Description
    Option
    Replacement for Optional.
  • Classes in javaslang.control used by javaslang.control 
    Class and Description
    Either
    Either represents a value of two possible types.
    Either.LeftProjection
    A left projection of an either.
    Either.RightProjection
    A right projection of an either.
    Failure
    A failed Try.
    Failure.Cause
    Causes wrap Throwables.
    Failure.NonFatal
    Use Failure.Cause.of(Throwable) to create instances of Failure.Fatal and Failure.NonFatal.
    Left
    The Left version of an Either.
    Match
    Match is a better switch for Java.
    Match.BooleanFunction
    A function f: boolean -> R that takes a primitive boolean value and returns a value of type R.
    Match.ByteFunction
    A function f: byte -> R that takes a primitive byte value and returns a value of type R.
    Match.Case
    A Match.Case which matches an Object by type or by value.
    Match.CharFunction
    A function f: char -> R that takes a primitive char value and returns a value of type R.
    Match.DoubleFunction
    A function f: double -> R that takes a primitive double value and returns a value of type R.
    Match.Expression
    A final Match expression which may be applied to an Object.
    Match.FloatFunction
    A function f: float -> R that takes a primitive float value and returns a value of type R.
    Match.IntFunction
    A function f: int -> R that takes a primitive int value and returns a value of type R.
    Match.LongFunction
    A function f: long -> R that takes a primitive long value and returns a value of type R.
    Match.ShortFunction
    A function f: short -> R that takes a primitive short value and returns a value of type R.
    Match.Typed
    The result of Match.ofType(Class), which explicitely sets the Match result type.
    None
    None is a singleton representation of the undefined Option.
    Option
    Replacement for Optional.
    Right
    The Right version of an Either.
    Some
    Some represents a defined Option.
    Success
    A succeeded Try.
    Try
    An implementation similar to Scala's Try control.
    Try.CheckedConsumer
    A Consumer which may throw.
    Try.CheckedFunction
    A Function which may throw.
    Try.CheckedPredicate
    A Predicate which may throw.
    Try.CheckedRunnable
    A Runnable which may throw.
    Try.CheckedSupplier
    A Supplier which may throw.
  • Classes in javaslang.control used by javaslang.test 
    Class and Description
    None
    None is a singleton representation of the undefined Option.
    Option
    Replacement for Optional.
    Some
    Some represents a defined Option.
